name: Spectrum Internet Assist
description: Affordable high-speed internet for households with member participating in National School Lunch Program, Community Eligibility Provision, or receiving SSI (65+)
fullDescription: Spectrum Internet Assist is Charter Communications' affordable internet program for qualifying low-income households, including seniors receiving SSI and families with students in free lunch programs.
whatTheyOffer:
- Affordable high-speed internet service (30 Mbps)
- No data caps or contracts
- Free modem included
- Free internet security suite
- In-home WiFi available for additional fee
howToGetIt:
1. Check if Spectrum service is available in your area
2. Must have student in National School Lunch Program (NSLP) or Community Eligibility Provision (CEP)
3. Or be 65+ and receiving Supplemental Security Income (SSI)
4. Apply online or call Spectrum
5. Cannot have prior Spectrum debt within last 12 months
